Schedule.title: Schedule
Schedule.welcome_details: Come join us on Friday night when you get in! Details to follow.
Schedule.reception_details: There will be a bus to take you from the ceremony to the reception venue!

Travel.title: Travel
Travel.plane_details: This is the closest airport. We would recommend booking ASAP. You can look through websites such as <momondo>momondo.com</momondo> or <kayak>kayak.com</kayak> for deals on flights.
Travel.plane_hotel: Our hotel blocks are a short cab / Lyft/Uber ride away (about 15 minutes) or via public transit (about 45 minutes)
Travel.around_summary: We will have a bus that goes from the hotels to the ceremony, ceremony to reception, and reception back to the hotels! But for getting around on the other days, here are a few options.
Travel.public_1: Boston is a very walkable city. Lots of interesting things are close to each other, making it easier to walk or take public transit options to get around most times.
Travel.public_2: The trains and busses (<mbta>MBTA</mbta>) are an affordable and extensive way to get around Boston. Each ride on subway is $2.40 and bus is $1.70. However, if you’re planning to stay for a bit, we’d recommend getting a pass. Daily passes are $12.75 for 24 hours of travel and $22.50 for a weekly pass.
Travel.taxi: Lyfts and Ubers are readily available in Boston, as are taxi cabs. This makes a good way to transport a few people around town.
Travel.rental: You can rent a car right from the airport if you wish! The parking at the hotel blocks is $12.00 overnight and day parking is $6.00.

Lodging.title: Lodging
Lodging.blocks: Room Block Rates available to book at this link:
Lodging.boston_north: AC Hotel by Marriott Boston North
Lodging.airbnb_details: If you are looking for more of an apartment/home instead of a hotel, Airbnb is always a good place to start. The hotel is in the medford area, but feel free to book a place more in the city there are lots of great neighborhoods to look at! Let us know if you need a recommendation!
